main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported over Kyushu, Japan on October 27, 1952. The objects were described as bright lights, maneuvering erratically and changing shape, with speeds and altitudes beyond known aircraft capabilities.
interesting points: Several credible witnesses, including pilots and radar observers, reported sightings of the UFOs.
The objects were observed at different altitudes, ranging from 10,000 to 45,000 feet, and were seen to change color and motion rapidly.
Attempts were made by aircraft to intercept and identify the objects, but the UFOs accelerated rapidly, making it difficult to establish contact.
The UFOs were observed for a significant duration, ranging from 5 to 45 minutes, before disappearing from sight.
Witnesses reported that the objects did not resemble any known aircraft and displayed unusual maneuverability, such as hovering, rapid climbing, and erratic movements.
sighted object: multiple bright lights, some changing shape
witnesses: pilots, radar observers, air defense personnel
